commit_list.message:
replace unsafeWindow communication with a "secure" channel

basic idea of the 'protocol':

* Addon creates custom event in document for a "handshake", and listens
there. Completely public.

* Userscript sends a message with that event with name/namespace and a
nonce, which is set with GM_setValue

* Addon builds the config key name with that name/namespace, and checks
that the userscript effectively set that value, ignoring the handshake
if it's not correct

* Addon creates a "secret" for the event name an uuid, and sets it to
another config value that can be accessed by the userscript.
The event itself is created and listened on.

* Addon replies with the same handshake public event, only notifying that
it was successful.

* Userscript receives that reply, reads the secret event name from the
config, listens on that event and sends messages through it too.

commit_list.message:
add defaults to instance._data, fix a bug with ListField

ie.
class TestSchem(DocumentSchema):
    a = TextField()

class TestDoc(Document):
    test = ListField("TestSchem")

t = TestDoc.wrap({})
t.test.append(TestSchem(a="test"))

print t.test
print t.unwrap()

before:
< []
< {'test': []}

after:
< [{'a': u'test'}]
< {'test': [{'a': u'test'}]}

commit_list.message:
added DocumentSchema to mapping and lazy attributes to avoid circular references

DocumentSchema it's like a Document that can be a property of a Document
the idea it's taken from couchdbkit
Example:
class Doc(Document):
    # this lazy attributes take the DocumentSchema, 'Test',  from
    # current module even if it doesn't exists yet
    test_list = ListField('Test')
    test_dict = DictField(schema='Test')
    test_field = Test()

class Test(DocumentSchema):
    text = TextField()

>>> doc = Doc()
>>> doc.test_list.append(Test(test="teeeeeest"))
>>> doc.test_dict["index"] = Test(test="42")
>>> doc.test_field = Test(text="test test")

fixed qt aplications never come back from close to tray

For compatibility with obsolete clients, window managers should trigger
the transition to the Withdrawn state on the real UnmapNotify rather
than waiting for the synthetic one. They should also trigger the
transition if they receive a synthetic UnmapNotify on a window for which
they have not yet received a real UnmapNotify.
http://tronche.com/gui/x/icccm/sec-4.html#s-4.1.4

commit_list.message:
add support to add dgroup rules from ipc

Example:

from libqtile.commdands import Client
c = Client()

match_args = {"title": ["test"]}
rule_args = {"float": True, "intrusive": True,
             "group": "somegroup", "break_on_match": True}

rule_id = client.add_rule(match_args, rule_args) # add rule
client.remove_rule(rule_id) # removes the rule

commit_list.message:
moved rules from Group to dgroups_app_rules and moved Rule to config

this rules makes no sense in the group object becouse they are group
independent.
config example:

dgroups_app_rules = [
        # Everything i want to be float, but don't want to change group(intrusive)
        Rule(Match(title=['nested', 'gscreenshot'],
                   wm_class=['Gcr-prompter', 'Ghost',
                        re.compile('Gnome-keyring-prompt.*?')],
                   wm_type=['dialog', 'utility', 'splash'],
                   ),
            float=True, intrusive=True),

        # floating windows
        Rule(Match(wm_class=["plugin-container", 'Gimp', 'Wine', 'Xephyr']),
            float=True),
        ]

commit_list.message:
fixed qt aplications never come back from close to tray

For compatibility with obsolete clients, window managers should trigger
the transition to the Withdrawn state on the real UnmapNotify rather
than waiting for the synthetic one. They should also trigger the
transition if they receive a synthetic UnmapNotify on a window for which
they have not yet received a real UnmapNotify.
http://tronche.com/gui/x/icccm/sec-4.html#s-4.1.4

Don't crash qtile if you try to use a widget that has unmet deps

Some users don't realize they are trying to use some widgets that needs
optional dependencies, regardless of the fact, the log warns about that
in the startup of qtile.

This replaces the "broken" widgets with a textbox saying the widget has
an import error.

Closes #1122

commit_list.message:
fix rendering border/shadow on the screenshot

The main problem was that gtk wont tell us when the window is really
removed from the screen.
So what this do is instead of hide the window, we resize it to 1px and
move it off screen, but the trick is to wait for the expose event, so we
know that the window is already moved/repainted
